Key Match Events: Evidence Magkopa scored the goal that put Bafana Bafana in the lead on 57 minutes.
Hakimi missed a penalty on 85 minutes that would have equalized for Morocco.
Tebboho Mokoena scored a freekick on 90+5 minutes to double South Africa's lead and seal their qualification to the quarter-finals.
Amrabat received a straight red card on 90+2 minutes for a foul on Mokoena.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco, the tournament favourites, were looking to become the first African side to reach the semi-finals of a World Cup.
Morocco top their group with seven points, but now fall when it matters most.
South Africa's coach made some changes to his starting lineup without injured players Sofiane Boufal and Hakim Ziyech.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa will meet Cape Verde in the quarter-finals, while Morocco's time in the tournament has come to an end.
Morocco's coach, Walid Regragui, will be reflecting on what went wrong for his team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the San-Pedro stadium, with South Africa producing one of the shocks of the 2023 Africa Cup of Nations.
The Atlas Lions struggled to create much against South Africa, while Bafana Bafana looked to slice open the Moroccan defence with a through pass from Zwane.
